alert.note: Alert for Macomb (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 25 at 6:09AM EDT until further notice by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Michigan... Lower Rouge River At Dearborn affecting Wayne County. North Branch Clinton Near Mt Clemens affecting Macomb County. Clinton River Near Clinton Township affecting Macomb County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Michigan... Middle Rouge River Near Dearborn Heights affecting Wayne County. .Recent heavy rainfall has caused the rises on area rivers. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...North Branch Clinton Near Mt Clemens. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 AM EDT Friday the stage was 15.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to crest at minor flood today. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Impact...At 15.0 feet, Agricultural land along the river begins to flood. When the river reaches this level due to rain, the Middle Branch Clinton River usually is flooding in some locations. The middle branch will crest about 24 hours earlier than the north branch. 21 and 22 Mile Roads may be flooded. Water could also reach the foundation of a few homes along the bank of the middle branch by Heyndrich and Cass Avenue. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
